Kekeringan, Warga Bautasik Belu Konsumsi Air Keruh
05 Nov 2019, 20:03 by ferdinandus asy


Kekeringan, Warga Bautasik Belu Konsumsi Air Keruh

KBRN, Atambua : Warga Dusun Bautasik Desa Kabuna wilayah perbatasan Kabupaten Belu, akibat kemarau panjang saat ini, cukup merasakan kesulitan memperoleh air bersih.Di musim kemarau panjang saat ini yang bisa dilakukan warga dusun setempat, agar bisa memenuhi kebutuhan hidup setiap hari, dengan menggali tanah ataupun membuat lubang-lubang kecil pada pasir sebagai tempat resapan air, baru kemudian ditimba."Air susah sementara kami menderita air. Kami ambil air sampai di kali sana," keluh Eufedius Martinus Mau Buti warga dusun setempat, Tak Bayar Pajak, KPP Pratama Malang Utara Lakukan Penyanderaan WPÂ Selasa (5/11/2019).Menurutnya, kekeringan panjang sejumlah sumur galipun yang selama ini dimanfaatkan warga mulai mengering terpaksa harus mengkonsumsi air pasir yang mulai keruh karena debit air mulai menurun."Ini kita minum pake air pasir, kita garuk-garuk pasir kasih keluar dia punya kotoran itu, baru kita timba di pinggir kali. Air keruh ew kami datang masak baru saring ko pake minum," papar Eufedius.Ia menjelaskan karena tak kunjung turun hujan sumber air di lokasi kalipun semakin mengering, salah satu alternatif semata mata memesan layanan tangky air itupun dengan biaya cukup mahal hingga Rp.150.000.

Drought, Bautasik Residents Belu Consumption of Turbid Water
05 Nov 2019, 20:03 by ferdinandus asy


Drought, Bautasik Residents Belu Consumption of Turbid Water

KBRN, Atambua: Residents of Bautasik Hamlet, Kabuna Village, Belu Regency border region, due to the current drought, it is quite difficult to get clean water. In the long dry season that can be done by local hamlet residents, so they can fulfill their daily needs, by digging land or make small holes in the sand as water catchment, then they are drained. "The water is difficult while we suffer from water. We take water up to the river," complained Eufedius Martinus Mau Buti, a local hamlet resident, Paying Taxes, KPP Pratama North Malang Conducts WP Hostage Tuesday (11/05/2019). According to him, the long drought of a number of galapun wells which so far have been used by residents began to have to consume sand water which began to become turbid because water discharge began to decline. "We drink this using sand water, we scratch the sand to give it out he has the dirt, then we dip in the edge of the river. The water is cloudy ew we come cooking then filtered out using drink, " Eufedius explained. He explained that because water sources did not rain at the location even though it dried up, one of the alternatives was merely ordering water tank service with a quite expensive cost of up to Rp.150,000.
